sentences.sContent: Could you open the door for me?
The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
sentences.sCn: 门一下子打开了，露丝气冲冲地跑了进来。

sentences.sContent: Don’t forget to lock the garage door.
sentences.sCn: 别忘了把车库的门锁上。

sentences.sContent: Marc appeared through a door at the far end of the room.
sentences.sCn: 马克从房间另一端的门口出现。

sentences.sContent: the family that lives three doors up from us
sentences.sCn: 住在与我们相隔三户的那户人家

sentences.sContent: ...The door into the family room isn’t big enough...
...the kitchen has one door into the dining room...
...hoping that once they had tempted customers through the door they would be persuaded to order more expensive items...
...Certainly! Tickets at the door are usually sold at a higher price...
...That day he ran into a roll-up door at the Lummis facility in Valero...
...She went to work at that wealthy school district next door — for less money...
...That is the new offerings companies are pushing out the door every six months or so are me-too products or ones with just a couple of new features...
...but someone comes to the door and says electricity or gas...
...the door opened and in walked a customer...

phrases.pCn: 挨家挨户地；自始至终地

trans.tranOther: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard/closet
